topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Developing in Node

body.p: Application Lifecycle Service has a built in Node framework with multiple versions of the Node.js runtime. NPM is used to install Node packages automatically.
Deployable sample applications are available in this language.

section.title: NPM
section.p:
Your application should list dependencies in a standard, top-level
package.json file. Application Lifecycle Service automatically installs packages listed in the "dependencies" section before starting the server.
Alternatively, you can call NPM directly using hooks in the manifest.yml file.
For NPM packages which include callable scripts or binaries, executable components are automatically added to the container's \$PATH, so a "global install" (npm install -g) is not required.

section.title: Host and Port Environment Variables
section.p: Deploying Node applications to Application Lifecycle Service requires changing some application settings to use instance-specific values. These values are provided to Application Lifecycle Service using environment variables. For example, the application is not allowed to arbitrarily choose which port it runs on. section.title: Using Data Services
section.p: Data services need to be configured with values from VCAP_SERVICES, DATABASE_URL, or a database-specific environment variable (see also Using Database Services).
If the database module you use supports URL-formatted connection strings, using the database-specific URL variable (REDIS_URL, MONGODB_URL, etc.) is often the simplest option.
